title: K-12 Mobile Math Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Through Learning Design Decision Tracking

context.prior_knowledge: University-level foundational mathematics knowledge (functions, calculus, linear algebra, etc.)
context.additional_context: Mobile-based short-term intensive course for job seekers to cultivate practical mathematical problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Learners can track and solve math problems occurring in real employment settings using a LEED tracker to monitor design decisions
Learners can revise design decisions at least three times and incorporate feedback during a four-week design cycle

Learners can analyze three or more statistical datasets (bar graphs, pie charts, etc.) collected in mobile environments, select appropriate mathematical approaches (mean/median/mode calculation or trendline prediction), and propose problem-solving solutions with 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
